## Purpose

This document historically provided technical and regulatory guidance for AI agents working on Tillerstead LLC’s codebase, with a focus on TCNA (Tile Council of North America) standards, ANSI/NTCA best practices, and New Jersey Home Improvement Contractor (HIC) compliance.

## Standards & Authority

- **TCNA**: Tile installation authority (Handbook 2024)
- **ANSI A108/A118/A137**: Installation and material standards (2024)
- **NTCA**: Reference Manual for methods and troubleshooting
- **NJ Division of Consumer Affairs**: HIC License #13VH12293200
- **OSHA**: Safety (1926.1153 silica, 1926.501 fall protection)

## 2024-2025 Key Compliance Updates

### Large Format Tile (LFT)
- **Definition**: ≥15" on any side (TCNA 2024)
- **Coverage**: 95% thinset (ANSI A108.5-2024)
- **Mortar**: Modified, ISO 13007 C2 minimum
- **Back-buttering**: Mandatory for tiles >24"
- **Substrate flatness**: 1/8" in 10' (rectified)

### Gauged Porcelain Tile Panels (GPTP)
- **Thickness**: 3–6mm, up to 5'×10'
- **Mortar**: ANSI A118.15, polymer-modified
- **Trowel**: 1/2" × 1/2" square notch minimum

### Waterproofing
- **Membranes**: ANSI A118.10 compliant (sheet or liquid)
- **Crack isolation**: Recommended for all floors
- **Cure times**: 24–72 hours (per product)
- **Shower pan**: IRC P2709, waterproofing 3" above showerhead rough-in

### Substrate & Underlayment
- **Deflection**: L/360 (floors)
- **Concrete**: 28-day cure minimum
- **CBU**: Required in wet areas, 1/2" thickness
- **Plywood**: 1-1/8" total, exterior-grade

## Modern Materials & Methods

- **Thinset**: Use C2S1/C2TE S1 for LFT/GPTP (Mapei, Laticrete, Ardex, Schluter)
- **Grout**: Epoxy (A118.3), urethane, or polymer-modified cement; joint width per TCNA 2024 (3/32" min rectified)
- **Uncoupling membranes**: Schluter DITRA/DITRA-XL for crack isolation and vapor management
- **Floor heating**: Electric mat systems (DITRA-HEAT, Warmup, NuHeat) under tile, GFCI-protected thermostat

## Carpentry & Substrate Prep

- **Joist spacing**: 16" o.c. max
- **Subfloor**: 3/4" plywood + 1/2" CBU or 3/8"–1/2" plywood (1-1/8" total)
- **Shower framing**: 2×4 studs 16" o.c., blocking at 72", pre-slope 1/4" per foot
- **Niches**: Slope bottom, waterproof, use prefab (KERDI-BOARD-SN, Wedi Fundo) or custom framed

## NJ HIC Compliance

- **License**: 13VH12293200 (display on all contracts/ads)
- **Contract**: Must include legal name, address, phone, HIC #, detailed scope, itemized costs, schedule, payment tied to milestones, 3-day rescission notice, warranty, change order process (N.J.S.A. 56:8-136)
- **Deposit**: Max 10% or $1,000 (whichever less)
- **Insurance**: $1M liability, workers comp if employees
- **Permits**: Required for structural, plumbing, electrical, major remodels; always verify locally

## Safety & OSHA

- **Silica**: N95/P100 respirator, wet-cutting preferred (OSHA 1926.1153)
- **Fall protection**: Required at 6', compliant ladders/scaffolding (OSHA 1926.501)
- **Chemical safety**: Gloves for thinset/grout, ventilation for solvents, SDS on site

## Industry Terminology

- **Back-buttering**: Thinset on tile back
- **Lippage**: Uneven tile height
- **CBU**: Cement backerboard
- **DITRA/KERDI**: Schluter membranes
- **LFT/GPTP**: Large format/gauged porcelain tile panels

## Best Practices

- **Always cite TCNA/ANSI standards**
- **Balance code minimum with best practice**
- **Recommend permit verification**
- **Highlight safety for DIY**
- **List multiple product options (NJ suppliers)**
- **Use professional, accessible language**
- **Distinguish Tillerstead’s technical edge:**
   - TCNA-literate, NJ HIC-compliant, modern methods, zero shortcuts

## Red Flags

- Insufficient thinset coverage
- Wrong mortar for porcelain
- Poor substrate prep/deflection
- Neglected grout sealing
- Inadequate waterproofing
- Ignoring NJ-specific climate/code

## Continuing Education

- **TCNA Handbook 2024**
- **NTCA Reference Manual**
- **Tile Magazine, TileLetter**
- **CTI/ACT/Schluter certifications**
- **OSHA 10/30**
